alert.note: Alert for Klamath (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 05 at 1:31PM PDT until May 09 at 4:47PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Medford has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Oregon... Sprague River near Beatty affecting Klamath County. For the Sprague River...including Beatty...elevated river levels are forecast. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday afternoon at 515 PM PDT. && ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...Sprague River near Beatty. * WHEN...From this afternoon to Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Widespread agricultural flooding can be expected downstream in the Sprague River Valley in the vicinity of Sprague River and Lone Pine. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:15 AM PDT Friday the stage was 8.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to remain steady. - Action stage is 7.5 feet. - Flood stage is 8.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
